title: James–Stein estimator
summary: The James–Stein estimator is a biased estimator of the mean, θ {\displaystyle {\boldsymbol {\theta }}} , of (possibly) correlated Gaussian distributed random vectors Y = { Y 1 , Y 2 , . . . , Y m } {\displaystyle Y=\{Y_{1},Y_{2},...,Y_{m}\}} with unknown means { θ 1 , θ 2 , . . . , θ m } {\displaystyle \{{\boldsymbol {\theta }}_{1},{\boldsymbol {\theta }}_{2},...,{\boldsymbol {\theta }}_{m}\}} .
